metadata.title: SourceLibrary.org Translation Roadmap
metadata.description: Prioritized list of Latin works for translation, based on USTC edition counts, historical significance, translation gaps, and alignment with BPH esoteric traditions
metadata.methodology: Works scored by: historical impact (USTC editions), translation gap severity, feasibility (length/difficulty), and audience potential. Esoteric/hermetic works scored with additional weight for BPH alignment.

historical_impact.description: USTC edition count as proxy for historical importance/readership

translation_gap.description: Severity of gap: completely untranslated vs partially available

feasibility.description: Length and difficulty for a single translator

audience.scale: 1-10 based on field activity and crossover appeal

tier_1_highest_priority.description: Major gaps with significant historical impact - ideal starting projects

works.author: Baptista Mantuanus
works.title: Parthenice Mariana
works.existing_translations: Eclogues translated (Piepho 1989), but religious epics completely unavailable
works.significance: 600+ editions by 1600. Set precedent for religious epic, influenced Sannazaro and Milton. Required grammar school reading across Europe.
works.digitization: Multiple scans available on Google Books, BSB
works.notes: High impact, moderate length, poetry requires care but not technical vocabulary. Good visibility project.

works.author: Hermann Conring
works.title: De Origine Juris Germanici
works.existing_translations: Only 'New Discourse on the Roman-German Emperor' translated (Fasolt)
works.significance: Foundational work that earned him title 'founder of German legal history'. Disproved Lotharian legend, established Germany's legal independence from Rome.
works.notes: Legal Latin is technical but this is THE foundational text for German legal history. Would fill major gap.

works.author: Alexander de Villa Dei
works.title: Doctrinale puerorum
works.existing_translations: Excerpts in Copeland & Sluiter (2012) scholarly edition, no accessible complete translation
works.significance: Perhaps THE most important medieval pedagogical text. 12 parts covering all Latin grammar. Fundamental throughout 13th-16th centuries.
works.notes: Verse format makes it memorable. Would be valuable for medieval education studies.

works.author: Justus Lipsius
works.title: Collected Letters and Minor Works
works.existing_translations: De Constantia (multiple), Politica (Waszink). But extensive correspondence and other philosophical works unavailable.
works.significance: 80+ editions of De Constantia alone. Foundational for Neostoicism. Network of 4,000+ letters to European intellectuals.
works.notes: Letters could be done selectively. High crossover appeal to philosophy, intellectual history audiences.

works.author: Juan Luis Vives
works.title: De Anima et Vita (complete)
works.existing_translations: Only Book 3 (Passions of the Soul) translated by Noreña 1990. Books 1-2 on soul and intellect unavailable.
works.significance: Called 'father of modern psychology'. First empirical study of emotions and their bodily relations. Brill series underway but incomplete.
works.notes: Completing this would be major contribution. History of psychology audience.

tier_2_lutheran_theology.description: Major Lutheran Orthodox theologians - specialized but underserved audience

works.author: Jakob Martini
works.title: Anti-Socinian Works
works.existing_translations: Nothing in English
works.significance: 836 editions - among highest in USTC. Established Lutheran structure for Metaphysics. Leading opponent of Socinianism.
works.notes: Extremely high edition count but very specialized audience.

works.author: Abraham Calov
works.title: Systema locorum theologicorum (selections)
works.existing_translations: Only excerpts in 'Atonement in Lutheran Orthodoxy' (2024). Owned by J.S. Bach.
works.significance: Climax of Lutheran scholasticism. The 'Bach Bible' - Bach's personal copy with extensive annotations.
works.notes: Full translation impractical. Strategic selections would be valuable. Bach connection provides hook.

works.author: Balthasar Meisner
works.title: Meditationes in Evangelia Dominicalia
works.existing_translations: Only 'Selected Meditations' available
works.significance: Leading Lutheran theologian 1611-1626. Defined theology as genuinely practical enterprise.
works.notes: Devotional genre more accessible. Could appeal beyond academic audience.

tier_3_reformed_theology.description: Dutch Reformed theologians - gap in anglophone scholarship

works.author: Johannes Hoornbeek
works.title: De Ratione Concionandi
works.existing_translations: Other works translated (Spiritual Desertion, On Conversion of Indians), but first Reformed homiletic textbook unavailable
works.significance: First systematic Reformed treatise on preaching post-Reformation. Voetian Circle member.
works.notes: Practical preaching manual. Would serve seminary/pastoral audience.

works.author: Samuel Maresius
works.title: Systema theologiae
works.existing_translations: Excerpts on iconbusters.org only
works.significance: Used as textbook in Reformed circles. 'Literary pugilist' against Catholics, Socinians, Arminians.
works.notes: Large undertaking. Selections might be more feasible.

works.author: Johannes Leusden
works.title: Philologus Hebraeus
works.existing_translations: Only his English Hebrew grammar (1686) available
works.significance: Goes far beyond philology to comprehensive study of Judaism and Jewish life. His Hebrew Bible (1661) first with numbered verses.
works.notes: Christian Hebraism is growing field. Would serve Jewish-Christian studies.

tier_4_legal_history.description: Legal texts - specialized audience but foundational works

works.author: Bartolus de Saxoferrato
works.title: Selected Commentaries and Consilia
works.existing_translations: Only 'Three Tracts on City Government' (Cambridge) - political works. Legal commentaries untranslated.
works.significance: Most prominent continental jurist of Medieval Roman Law. ~400 legal opinions (consilia).
works.notes: Massive corpus. Strategic selection needed. Legal history specialists only.

works.author: Samuel Stryk
works.title: Specimen Usus Moderni Pandectarum
works.existing_translations: Only 'De Iure Pontium' (1700) bilingual edition
works.significance: Pioneering work on modern usage of Roman law. Foundational for German legal development.
works.notes: Very technical. Legal history specialists only.

works.author: Christoph Besold
works.title: Political Works (Synopsis Politicae Doctrinae)
works.existing_translations: Scholarly articles about his work, no translations
works.significance: Transformed reformers' message into legal claim for natural right to believe. Critique of absolutism.
works.notes: Political theory more accessible than technical legal. Religious freedom angle has modern relevance.

tier_5_grammar_pedagogy.description: Educational texts - specialized but historically crucial

works.author: Aelius Donatus
works.title: Ars Grammatica (Ars Major)
works.existing_translations: Ars Minor translated (Johnson). Ars Major (full grammar, figures of speech, tropes) unavailable.
works.significance: Most popular medieval Latin textbook for 1000+ years. Still used in Britain 19th century.
works.notes: Short, foundational, high impact. Good quick-win project.

works.author: Antonio de Nebrija
works.title: Introductiones Latinae
works.existing_translations: Spanish grammar prologue translated. Latin grammar itself unavailable.
works.significance: Official Latin textbook in Spanish universities. Reprinted ~100 times in New World.
works.notes: Spanish/Latin American studies angle. Colonial education history.

works.author: Jean Despautère
works.title: Commentarii grammatici
works.existing_translations: None
works.significance: Basis for Latin instruction in Jesuit colleges in France until 18th century.
works.notes: Jesuit education history angle. Large undertaking.

works.author: Rudolph Goclenius
works.title: Lexicon Philosophicum
works.existing_translations: None
works.significance: Credited with coining 'psychology'. First systematic use of 'ontology'. 'Microcosmic library' of early modern philosophy.
works.notes: Reference format could allow partial/selective translation. History of concepts angle.

tier_7_quick_wins.description: Shorter works that could be completed quickly for momentum

works.author: Baptista Mantuanus
works.title: Adulescentia (annotated modern edition)
works.existing_translations: Piepho 1989, but could use fresh accessible edition
works.notes: Poetry, engaging, could build audience for later religious epics

works.author: Various
works.title: Anthology of Untranslated Neo-Latin Poetry
works.significance: 24,727 poetry editions in USTC, vast majority untranslated
works.notes: Flexible scope. Could highlight forgotten poets. Good for building readership.

tier_8_hermetica_prisca_theologia.description: BPH Priority - Hermetic and Prisca Theologia texts

works.author: Francesco Patrizi
works.title: Nova de universis philosophia
works.existing_translations: None in English. Italian studies exist.
works.significance: Major Hermetic cosmology integrating Hermes Trismegistus, Zoroaster, Orpheus into unified system. Dedicated to Pope Gregory XIV. Includes first printed edition of Chaldean Oracles and Hermetic fragments not in Ficino.
works.digitization: Available via Google Books, Munich BSB
works.bph_relevance: Core text for understanding Renaissance Hermeticism. Central to prisca theologia tradition.
works.notes: Foundational for BPH collection themes. Would be major scholarly contribution.

works.author: Agostino Steuco
works.title: De perenni philosophia libri X
works.existing_translations: None. Only scholarly articles about it.
works.significance: Coined 'philosophia perennis' - the perennial philosophy concept later adopted by Leibniz and Aldous Huxley. Traced ancient wisdom from Moses through Hermes, Orpheus, Pythagoras to Plato.
works.bph_relevance: Origin of 'perennial philosophy' concept central to esoteric thought.
works.notes: Would be landmark translation. Connects to modern perennialism (Guenon, Schuon).

works.author: Symphorien Champier
works.title: De quadruplici vita / Symphonia Platonis cum Aristotele
works.existing_translations: None
works.significance: Early French humanist attempt to harmonize Ficino's Hermeticism with Aristotelian scholasticism. Included excerpts from Corpus Hermeticum before Casaubon's critique.
works.bph_relevance: French reception of Ficinian Hermeticism.
works.notes: Good entry point to French Hermeticism.

tier_9_alchemy_chymistry.description: BPH Priority - Alchemical and Chymical texts

works.author: Various (ed. Lazarus Zetzner)
works.title: Theatrum Chemicum - Selected Treatises
works.existing_translations: Only scattered treatises translated individually. No systematic English selection.
works.significance: THE major early modern alchemical anthology. 6 volumes, ~200 treatises. Contains works by Arnald of Villanova, Roger Bacon, Geber, Lull (pseudo), and dozens of others. Jung drew heavily on it.
works.bph_relevance: Foundational alchemical compendium. BPH has multiple copies.
works.notes: Strategic selection of 10-20 most important treatises could be feasible project.

works.author: Michael Maier
works.title: Atalanta fugiens
works.existing_translations: De Jong 1969 (scholarly, expensive). Godwin 1989 (popular). Latin text with epigrams could use fresh translation.
works.significance: Extraordinary multimedia work: 50 emblems, 50 fugues (musical), 50 epigrams, 50 discourses. Alchemical symbolism at its most sophisticated.
works.bph_relevance: Iconic alchemical emblem book. BPH holds early editions.
works.notes: Existing translations dated or expensive. Fresh open-access version would serve wide audience.

works.author: Heinrich Khunrath
works.title: Amphitheatrum Sapientiae Aeternae
works.existing_translations: Only partial translations in anthologies. No complete scholarly edition.
works.significance: Fusion of Paracelsian alchemy, Kabbalah, and Christian mysticism. Famous engravings (Laboratory-Oratory). Major influence on Rosicrucianism.
works.bph_relevance: Core BPH text. Bridges alchemy and Christian Kabbalah.
works.notes: Difficult Latin with neologisms and wordplay. Would require extensive annotation.

works.author: Petrus Severinus
works.title: Idea medicinae philosophicae
works.existing_translations: None in any modern language
works.significance: THE foundational systematization of Paracelsus. Made Paracelsian ideas comprehensible to academic medicine. Royal physician to Frederick II of Denmark. Influenced Tycho Brahe.
works.digitization: Available via Google Books, Copenhagen Royal Library
works.bph_relevance: Essential for understanding Paracelsianism's spread. BPH core theme.
works.notes: TOP PRIORITY for esoteric/BPH track. Would fill massive gap in Paracelsian studies.

works.author: Joseph Duchesne (Quercetanus)
works.title: Ad veritatem hermeticae medicinae
works.existing_translations: Some vernacular works translated, but major Latin defenses of chemical medicine untranslated
works.significance: Physician to Henri IV. Major defender of Hermetic/chemical medicine against Galenists. Key figure in Paris Faculty of Medicine controversies.
works.bph_relevance: Hermetic medicine tradition central to BPH.
works.notes: Important for history of medicine and Hermetic tradition.

works.author: Oswald Croll
works.title: Basilica chymica
works.existing_translations: Only the prefatory 'Admonitory Preface' translated (published 1657). Main pharmaceutical work unavailable.
works.significance: Most influential iatrochemical textbook of 17th century. 15+ editions and translations. Systematized Paracelsian pharmacy.
works.bph_relevance: Major Paracelsian pharmaceutical manual.
works.notes: High edition count indicates importance. Technical pharmaceutical content.

works.author: Gerhard Dorn
works.title: Speculativae philosophiae and other works
works.existing_translations: Only excerpts in Jung's Alchemical Studies. No complete works.
works.significance: Major Paracelsian philosopher. Translated Paracelsus into Latin. Emphasized spiritual over material alchemy. Jung's primary source for psychological interpretation of alchemy.
works.digitization: In Theatrum Chemicum and individual editions
works.bph_relevance: Spiritual alchemy tradition. Jung connection increases modern interest.
works.notes: Very difficult Latin. Strategic selection needed. Jung connection provides audience.

works.author: Johannes Reuchlin
works.title: De arte cabalistica
works.existing_translations: Goodman & Salaman (2018, Inner Traditions). But earlier work De verbo mirifico (1494) untranslated.
works.significance: Foundational Christian Kabbalist alongside Pico. Defended Jewish books from burning. De verbo mirifico (1494) is actually untranslated.
works.bph_relevance: Core Christian Kabbalah. BPH foundational text.
works.notes: De arte cabalistica now translated. De verbo mirifico (1494) remains untranslated - that's the gap.

works.author: Johannes Reuchlin
works.title: De verbo mirifico
works.existing_translations: None in English. French translation exists.
works.significance: Reuchlin's FIRST kabbalistic work. Dialogue on the wonder-working word (Tetragrammaton). Precursor to De arte cabalistica. Introduced Christian Kabbalah to Germany.
works.bph_relevance: Essential early Christian Kabbalah text.
works.notes: Should be translated alongside De arte cabalistica for complete picture.

works.author: Guillaume Postel
works.title: Clavis absconditorum a constitutione mundi
works.existing_translations: None. Only scholarly studies.
works.significance: Visionary Christian Kabbalist. First European to study Arabic in Middle East. Claimed mystical union with 'Mother Johanna'. Prophesied world unity under French king.
works.bph_relevance: Major figure in Christian Kabbalah and prophetic tradition.
works.notes: Eccentric but fascinating. Difficult Latin with Hebrew terms.

works.author: Francesco Giorgi (Zorzi)
works.title: De harmonia mundi totius
works.existing_translations: None. French translation 1578 exists. Only scholarly articles.
works.significance: Venetian Franciscan's synthesis of Pythagorean harmony, Kabbalah, and Neoplatonism. Influenced Dee, Fludd, Renaissance architecture. Consulted on Henry VIII's divorce.
works.bph_relevance: Musical/Kabbalistic cosmology. Central to BPH themes.
works.notes: Very large work. Musical/mathematical content requires specialized knowledge.

tier_12_rosicrucian_theosophy.description: BPH Priority - Rosicrucian and Theosophical texts

works.author: Robert Fludd
works.title: Utriusque Cosmi Historia
works.existing_translations: Only excerpts. Godwin selected translations (1979). No complete English version.
works.significance: Massive illustrated cosmological encyclopedia. Macrocosm (universe) and Microcosm (man). Famous engravings by De Bry. Defender of Rosicrucians against Kepler and Mersenne.
works.bph_relevance: Essential Rosicrucian encyclopedia. BPH holds early editions.
works.notes: Massive undertaking. Strategic selection of tractates more feasible.

works.author: Theophilus Schweighardt (Daniel Mögling)
works.title: Speculum Sophicum Rhodo-Stauroticum
works.existing_translations: None in English
works.significance: Key early Rosicrucian text with famous 'Collegium Fraternitatis' engraving. Explains Rosicrucian symbolism. Pseudonymous author later identified as mathematician Mögling.
works.bph_relevance: Core Rosicrucian primary source.
works.notes: Short, accessible, highly relevant. Good quick win for Rosicrucian studies.

works.author: Athanasius Kircher
works.title: Oedipus Aegyptiacus
works.existing_translations: Only excerpts in Stolzenberg (2013) and other studies.
works.significance: Monumental attempt to decode hieroglyphics through Hermetic lens. Wrong about hieroglyphics but treasure trove of Renaissance Hermeticism, Kabbalah, comparative religion.
works.bph_relevance: Encyclopedic Hermeticism. BPH holds copies.
works.notes: Impractical to translate completely. Thematic selections could work.

tier_13_natural_magic.description: BPH Priority - Natural Magic and Occult Philosophy

works.author: Giordano Bruno
works.title: Latin Magical Works (De magia, De vinculis, Theses de magia)
works.existing_translations: De magia translated by Dillon (2004). De vinculis and Theses less available. Yates excerpts.
works.significance: Bruno's mature magical philosophy. Theory of bonds (vincoli) linking magician to cosmos. Memory systems. Executed for heresy 1600.
works.bph_relevance: Major figure in Renaissance magic. Bruno central to esoteric tradition.
works.notes: Some translated but scattered. Collected accessible edition would be valuable.

works.author: Johannes Trithemius
works.title: Steganographia
works.existing_translations: Book 3 decoded as cryptography (1998). Earlier books combining cryptography with angel magic less accessible.
works.significance: Famous grimoire-style text. Circulated in manuscript, printed 1606. Actually sophisticated cryptographic manual disguised as angel summoning. Influenced Dee, Bruno.
works.bph_relevance: Bridges cryptography and angel magic. BPH interest.
works.notes: Cryptographic aspects now decoded. Magic-framing historically important.

works.author: Cornelius Gemma
works.title: De arte cyclognomica
works.existing_translations: None
works.significance: Louvain professor's synthesis of astrology, Kabbalah, prophecy. 'Cyclognomic art' = reading cosmic cycles. Son of Gemma Frisius. Observed supernova 1572.
works.bph_relevance: Astrology, prophecy, cosmic cycles - BPH themes.
works.notes: Obscure but significant for history of astrology and prophecy.

tier_14_early_science.description: BPH Priority - Early Science and Natural Philosophy (where esoteric meets empirical)

works.author: Girolamo Cardano
works.title: De subtilitate rerum
works.existing_translations: Only De vita propria (autobiography) translated. Major scientific works unavailable.
works.significance: Renaissance polymath's encyclopedia of nature. Covers physics, metals, animals, plants, man, universe. Influenced scientific revolution. Invented Cardan shaft, pioneered probability theory.
works.digitization: Available via Google Books, ETH Zurich
works.bph_relevance: Bridges Renaissance natural magic and emerging science. Includes occult sympathies alongside empirical observation.
works.notes: Major gap. Cardano fundamental to history of science but Latin works largely inaccessible.

works.author: Girolamo Cardano
works.title: De rerum varietate
works.existing_translations: None
works.significance: Sequel to De subtilitate. More on natural wonders, demons, divination, alchemy. Shows intersection of empirical and occult in Renaissance thought.
works.bph_relevance: Contains extensive material on divination, demons, occult phenomena alongside natural philosophy.
works.notes: Companion to De subtilitate. Together they form major statement of Renaissance natural philosophy.

works.author: Giambattista della Porta
works.title: Magiae naturalis libri XX
works.existing_translations: 1658 English translation exists but archaic. Modern scholarly edition lacking.
works.significance: Most influential natural magic text. 25+ editions. Covers optics, magnetism, alchemy, cryptography, distillation. Founded Accademia dei Segreti (first scientific society?).
works.bph_relevance: Definitive natural magic compendium. Shows transition from magic to experimental science.
works.notes: 1658 translation outdated. Modern annotated edition would be valuable.

works.author: Girolamo Fracastoro
works.title: De sympathia et antipathia rerum / De contagione
works.existing_translations: De contagione translated (Wright 1930). De sympathia untranslated.
works.significance: First germ theory of disease (seminaria). De sympathia explores occult qualities, attraction/repulsion in nature. Physician, poet (Syphilis poem), astronomer.
works.bph_relevance: Occult sympathies theory influential on later natural magic and early chemistry.
works.notes: De sympathia fills gap between translated medical work and his natural philosophy.

works.author: John Dee
works.title: Monas Hieroglyphica
works.existing_translations: Multiple translations exist (Josten 1964, Hamilton-Jones 1947). But highly obscure text.
works.significance: Dee's mystical mathematics. Single hieroglyphic symbol encoding cosmic truths. Influenced Rosicrucians, alchemy. Notoriously difficult.
works.bph_relevance: Core esoteric text. Dee central to BPH tradition.
works.notes: Already translated but could use fresh annotated edition explaining the mathematics.

works.author: Andreas Libavius
works.title: Alchemia
works.existing_translations: None. Only excerpts in secondary literature.
works.significance: First systematic chemistry textbook. Bridge between alchemy and modern chemistry. Attacked Paracelsians but systematized chemical knowledge. Famous laboratory design.
works.bph_relevance: Transition from alchemy to chemistry. Shows rationalization of esoteric tradition.
works.notes: Major gap in history of chemistry. Large but foundational.

works.author: Giambattista della Porta
works.title: De humana physiognomonia
works.existing_translations: Only 1586 Italian version accessible. Latin original untranslated.
works.significance: Most influential Renaissance physiognomy treatise. Famous woodcuts comparing human and animal faces. Influenced Lavater, Darwin on expression.
works.bph_relevance: Correspondence between microcosm and macrocosm. Natural signatures.
works.notes: Famous images, accessible Latin. Good crossover appeal to art history, psychology.

works.author: John Wilkins
works.title: Mercury, or the Secret and Swift Messenger
works.existing_translations: Originally in English - but his other works in Latin
works.significance: Early work on cryptography and secret communication. Later founded Royal Society. Shows transition from occult to scientific.
works.notes: Originally English. Include here for completeness of early science theme.

works.author: Daniel Sennert
works.title: De chymicorum cum Aristotelicis et Galenicis consensu ac dissensu
works.existing_translations: None
works.significance: Key work reconciling Paracelsian chemistry with Aristotelian/Galenic medicine. Atomist. Influenced Boyle. Professor at Wittenberg.
works.bph_relevance: Integration of chemical philosophy into academic medicine.
works.notes: Important for understanding how alchemy became chemistry.

phase_1_foundation.rationale: Short foundational grammar + high-impact poetry. Builds credibility and audience.

phase_2_expansion.rationale: Mix of pedagogy, philosophy, practical theology. Different audiences.

phase_3_major_projects.rationale: Larger foundational works that establish SourceLibrary as serious resource.

track_b_bph_esoteric.description: BPH/Esoteric Track - Hermetic, Alchemical, Kabbalistic traditions

phase_1_quick_wins.rationale: Short Rosicrucian text (high score 8.2) + fresh Atalanta translation. Immediate BPH relevance, builds esoteric audience.

phase_2_foundational_esoteric.rationale: Foundational Paracelsianism (8.1), first Christian Kabbalah (7.9), origin of 'perennial philosophy' (7.8). Core BPH themes.

phase_3_major_esoteric.rationale: Major Hermetic cosmology, Christian alchemy/Kabbalah synthesis, musical-Kabbalistic cosmology. Landmark translations.

phase_4_long_term.rationale: Strategic selections from massive encyclopedic works. Collaborative or long-term projects.

ongoing_projects_elsewhere: Johann Gerhard - Loci Theologici (Concordia, 17 vols ongoing)
Juan Luis Vives - Selected Works (Brill series)
